Project.Brief history of your project and organi: The Marine Copernicus, provides free ocean data globally. It started with the MyOcean project (2008–2014) and became operational in 2015 under Mercator Ocean International, a French non-profit. It offers real-time and historical data on ocean physics, sea ice, and biogeochemistry, supporting EU policies and the Blue Economy.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File: The Marine Copernicus stores global ocean biogeochemical data in the Filecoin. It includes daily and monthly parameters like chlorophyll, nutrients, oxygen, pH, and CO2, covering the global ocean at 0.25° resolution across 50 depth levels.
Project.How do you plan to prepare the dataset: As a data preparer, I would begin by segmenting the global ocean biogeochemical data into smaller, manageable chunks. Each chunk is encrypted for security and distributed across multiple storage nodes to ensure reliability and redundancy. Before distribution, the data is uploaded to the network, where it receives a unique Content Identifier (CID) for tracking. The system manages the entire process, from data preparation and encryption to storage and verification, generating cryptographic proofs to confirm data integrity. Using the CID, the data can be easily retrieved, decrypted, and accessed when needed.
Project.In which geographies do you plan on maki: Greater China, Asia other than Greater China, Africa, South America, North America, Europe, Australia (continent)
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: IPFS, HTTP or FTP server,Lotus built-in data transfer, Venus built-in data transfer
